title: South Korea elects opposition conservative to be next president
description: Conservative Yoon Suk Yeol is set to become South Korea's next president after Lee Jae-myung, from the ruling Democratic Party, conceded defeat.

title: This is the date the pandemic will feel like it's over for many Americans
description: There's been a debate for much of the last few months as to when we really will know that the Covid-19 pandemic is over.

title: Courteney Cox still doesn't remember 'Friends'
description: Please don't ask Courteney Cox to quote dialogue from "Friends" episodes.

title: Mariupol: 1,300 civilians dead, officials say, as city under siege
description: Russian forces bombed a maternity hospital in southern Ukraine, authorities there said Wednesday, an attack described by the country's President Volodymyr Zelensky as an "atrocity."

title: How the US is trying to help Ukraine without triggering a wider war with Russia
description: The swift US rejection of a Polish plan to get MiG-29 fighter jets into Ukraine is the clearest example yet of the complications that the US and its NATO allies face trying to help Ukraine defend itself against Russia's brutal assault while ensuring they don't get dragged into a wider war.

title: Novak Djokovic in the draw for Indian Wells, but his status remains unclear
description: Novak Djokovic features in the men's singles draw as the No. 2 seed at Indian Wells, but it remains unclear whether he will be able to compete when the men's tournament begins on Thursday due to his unvaccinated status.

title: Survivors of Russian bombardment share their stories
description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh goes to Mykolaiv, Ukraine, where he shares the stories of civilians injured by Russian attacks who still consider themselves lucky because they survived.

title: Why the US rejected Poland's plan to send fighter jets to Ukraine
description: The US on Tuesday rejected a proposal from Poland to send Soviet-era fighter jets to Ukraine by way of a US-NATO airbase in Germany, but is still working out how to fulfill Ukraine's urgent request for more fighter planes in its war with Russia, US officials have told CNN, though a straightforward solution does not appear imminent.

title: Ukraine's first lady steps up as powerful voice in battle against Putin
description: Olena Zelenska, the first lady of Ukraine, posted an open letter addressed to the world's media on Tuesday, detailing what she described as the "mass murder of Ukrainian civilians."

title: First sign of oil price relief: UAE says it wants OPEC to increase production
description: The oil market has been stretched incredibly thin, with few producers willing — or able —  to replace Russian barrels banned by the United States and shunned by others. Enter the United Arab Emirates, which suggested it may be coming to the rescue.

title: See Ewan McGregor return as Obi-Wan
description: Ewan McGregor will reprise his role as Obi-Wan Kenobi in a new Disney+ series.

title: Massive meteor crater discovered beneath Greenland's ice is much older than thought
description: The age of the meteor impact crater, discovered seven years ago underneath kilometer-deep ice in Greenland, had long puzzled scientists.

title: Affection from a dog really is medicinal, according to a new study
description: Dog lovers know that a little time with a wagging tail can make all the difference -- and science backs it up.

title: See what's left of maternity ward destroyed in bombing
description: Ukrainian officials are accusing Russian forces of bombing a maternity hospital in Mariupol, Ukraine. CNN's Scott McLean gives the latest of this developing story.

title: Renowned explorer's ship found 107 years after it sunk near Antarctica
description: Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship, HMS Endurance, was located by a team of scientists, historians and filmmakers more than a century after it sunk off the coast of Antarctica.

title: US steps up intelligence and surveillance efforts on North Korea following multiple missile launches
description: The United States is increasing its readiness in the Indo-Pacific region against North Korea, intensifying "intelligence, readiness and surveillance collection activities" related to North Korea following recent ballistic missile launches by Pyongyang, US Indo-Pacific Command announced Wednesday.

title: Analysis: This is the moment Putin acknowledges things are not going perfect
description: CNN's John King and Eurasia Group President Ian Bremmer analyze Russian President Vladimir Putin's most recent speech addressing the families of soldiers fighting in Ukraine.

title: TikTok users are debating whether there are more wheels or doors in the world
description: TikTok is a place to ponder life's big questions, like: What would a crowdsourced musical based on Pixar's "Ratatouille" sound like? Will a Southern sorority hopeful get a bid to her favorite Greek house? And what will today be like -- bones or no bones?

title: Fired Russian F1 driver announces fund to help other excluded athletes
description: Russian driver Nikita Mazepin hit back at the US-owned Haas Formula One team on Wednesday for firing him after his country's invasion of Ukraine and announced a foundation to support athletes unable to compete due to war or politics.

title: Zelensky calls strike on Mariupol hospital an 'atrocity'
Former NASA astronaut Scott Kelly and Russian space chief engage in Twitter fight
description: An extraordinary war of words is transpiring between the head of Russia's space agency and one of NASA's most famous former astronauts as the US-Russian partnership at the International Space Station hits its lowest point since its inception.

title: What keeps China from stopping Russia's war
description: The war in Ukraine has prompted renewed appeals for China to get involved in an international crisis, with commentators discussing how the country is well-placed to negotiate an end to the fighting. Politicians have taken up the call too: the Ukrainian foreign minister reportedly asked China to get involved, while on Tuesday European leaders video-called Chinese leader Xi Jinping in an effort to keep them in the loop.

title: Ernest Shackleton's Endurance ship found in Antarctica after 107 years
description: More than a century after it sank off the coast of Antarctica, polar explorer Ernest Shackleton's ship HMS Endurance has been located, apparently intact and in good condition.

title: How Putin 'destroyed' the ruble and brought Russia to the brink of default
Disney shows off its post-Iger politics
description: Disney's CEO transition from Bob Iger to Bob Chapek marked a shift from an outspoken, famous CEO with political ambitions, to a largely unfamiliar name whose politics remain a mystery. This week, we got a glimpse at how Chapek's Disney might respond to the world's tumultuous political climate.

title: Is this, finally, Kamala Harris' moment?
description: It's been a rough first year as vice president for Kamala Harris.

title: Patient who received genetically modified pig heart in groundbreaking transplant surgery dies
description: A 57-year-old Maryland man who had received a genetically modified pig heart in a first-of-its-kind transplant surgery has died, the University of Maryland Medical Center said Wednesday.

title: The world may be facing one of the largest energy shocks ever, Goldman Sachs says
description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the West's crackdown on Moscow has left the world economy exposed to an epic energy shock.

title: US charges two siblings in $124 million cryptocurrency fraud
description: US authorities on Tuesday filed criminal charges against a cryptocurrency executive and civil charges against him and his sister, accusing them of defrauding retail investors out of millions of dollars with a digital token known as Ormeus Coin.

title: Basketball star Brittney Griner is the latest American to be detained in Russia as supporters work desperately to free them
description: Brittney Griner, the star basketball player detained in Russia over alleged drug charges, has become the latest of several Americans who have yet to secure their freedom from a country increasingly isolated from the rest of the world.

title: Tinder is making criminal background checks available on your dates
description: Tinder wants to help people surface red flags about potential dates through quick and affordable criminal background checks.

title: Hear how Russian dad responded when his Ukrainian son told him what's happening
description: Ukrainian restaurateur Misha Katsurin joins New Day to discuss his personal experience with the propaganda that is being spread through Russian media about the war in Ukraine.

title: Russia's invasion of Ukraine puts Israel in a tricky spot
description: In Israel, when someone is trying to tread carefully, it is said that they are "walking between the raindrops" -- trying not to get wet.

title: LGBTQ Floridians once hoped DeSantis could be an ally. Not anymore
description: In his first year as Florida governor in 2019, Ron DeSantis paid a somber visit to the memorial for the 49 people who lost their lives when a man opened fire at Pulse, a gay nightclub in Orlando.

title: How Putin 'destroyed' the ruble and brought Russia to the brink of default
Russian gymnast has no regrets about wearing 'Z' symbol next to Ukrainian athlete: state media
description: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak, who has been widely criticized ​outside Russia for wearing a pro-war symbol on a podium next to a Ukrainian athlete, says he would "do exactly the same" if given another chance​, according to Russian state media.

title: A hotel room hidden in a sphere of birdhouses
description: Anyone with a bird feeder -- or a cat -- knows that watching the avian world go about its business can be mesmerizing. Now imagine being right at the center of the action in a spherical room suspended among the trees, covered in 350 birdhouses.

title: What Prague 1968 teaches us about Ukraine 2022
description: In the early hours of an August day in 1968, I was awakened by the continuous thunder of heavy planes flying low overhead -- we lived relatively close to Prague's largest airport.

title: Andy Murray to donate 2022 season prize money to Ukrainian children
description: Andy Murray has pledged to donate the remainder of his 2022 season's prize money to help children in Ukraine.

title: Amazon is about to shake up one of the world's biggest film industries
description: In its hunt for content, Amazon Prime Video has turned to Nigeria, where it has secured key deals with studios that could shake up business in Africa's most prolific filmmaking hub.

title: Our sun keeps flaring and these 2 missions are capturing it all
description: The sun is getting more active -- and two solar missions are perfectly poised to capture the stellar show.

title: Russian forces almost destroyed this Ukrainian artist's work. Now it's becoming a global symbol of peace
description: Not only is Maria Prymachenko among the 20th century's great self-taught artists, she is an icon of Ukrainian national identity. Her fantastical paintings, praised during her lifetime by the likes of Pablo Picasso, are now found in some of the country's most important museums. Her work has also been featured on postage stamps and her likeness is immortalized on commemorative coins.

title: Cathay will fly only 2% of normal passenger capacity as Hong Kong remains sealed off
description: Cathay Pacific plans to continue operating at just minuscule levels as its home city remains largely cut off from the rest of the world.

title: DNA from bite mark leads to arrest in 1994 killing of California woman, authorities say
description: DNA evidence taken from a bite mark left on a victim led California detectives to charge a man with murder nearly 28 years after a woman was stabbed to death in her apartment, officials said Tuesday.

title: 'He's in a corner': Expert breaks down Putin's nuclear threats
description: Western countries have rejected President Volodymyr Zelensky's call for a no-fly zone over Ukraine due to concerns about provoking a more direct confrontation with Russian forces, especially after President Vladimir Putin's threat to resort to nuclear weapons. CNN's Nina dos Santos has more on how the West is analyzing those threats.

title: Mystery surrounds 400-year-old hunting bow
description: A 54-inch wooden hunting bow found in Alaska's Lake Clark National Park and Preserve in September 2021 likely dates back to around 1562, according to radiocarbon dating, but researchers and Dena'ina Athabascan experts remain puzzled about how it ended up in the waters of an inland lake. CNN affiliate KTUU reports.

title: A hidden door in woman's home leads to an even bigger surprise
description: A woman doing spring cleaning in her attic discovered boxes filled with love letters dating back to the 1950's and tracked down the couple's grandson. WTVR's Greg McQuade has the story.

title: Teen's attempt to rescue cat takes an unexpected turn
description: A Good Samaritan needed to be rescued while trying to rescue a cat in a tree. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: 'Mom, I'm alive!': See one mother's reaction after finding son
description: After more than a week of heavy bombardment around their homes, Ukrainians from a Kyiv suburb struggle to survive while evacuating and leaving their loved ones behind. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports.

title: How Zelensky is using social media to dominate the information war
description: CNN's Brian Todd looks at how Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is using social media to boost Ukrainians' morale and win the information war with Russia.
